row.AboutMe:
Hi, I'm not really a person.

I'm a background process that helps keep this site clean!

I do things like

  • Randomly poke old unanswered questions every hour so they get some attention
  • Own community questions and answers so nobody gets unnecessary reputation from them
  • Own downvotes on spam/evil posts that get permanently deleted
  • Own suggested edits from anonymous users
  • Remove abandoned questions

Full-time Internet. Gamer. Developer at Stack Exchange.

Formerly a community manager and elected moderator on Stack Overflow/Programmers Stack Exchange.

Email me and tell me something interesting: anna@stackexchange.com.

I like programming, puns, and long walks on the beach.

...Virtual beaches.

I've got a chat bot: http://meta.stackexchange.com/users/278477

My name is Tim. I've just finished my GCSEs - Maths, Ad-Maths, English (Lit and Lang), Science (Triple), French, Geography, Product Design and Computer Science, plus Ethics a while ago.

In my spare time I do computer programming using python, but also shell scripts answering questions on Stack Exchange - almost all Ubuntu.

Here are my wallpapers (I have them on a 1 hour cycle), in case you see them in a screenshot I post: https://goo.gl/0QJtkC (A Google drive folder, nothing bad - just animals.)

developer, techie, nerd.... Community Manager for Stack Exchange

If needed, contact me via email at bluefeet@stackoverflow.com.

A qualified chemist who somehow drifted into web development. I've learned (to a greater or lesser degree of accuracy) PHP and JavaScript, and would like to learn something completely different for the sake of it. I'm a weirdo who actually enjoys reading (and sometimes writing) technical documentation.

I build things.

Walking on water and developing software from a specification are easy if both are frozen.
-- Edward V Berard

  • Personal website
  • GitHub profile
  • Careers 2.0 profile
  • Development blog

Stack Exchange employs me as a Community Manager. I've been known to respond to jericson@stackexchange.com. Alternatively, I maintain an office on chat. (Please ignore the meta cruft.)

I write about my experience as a community manager at jericson.github.io. You can read about what I've done over the years in my curriculum vitae.

On a personal note, I'm married and have three children. Our oldest son loves school, friends, games, and reading. (He can't wait to get on our LEGO® Answers site, but he's not quite old enough. My posts there are usually at his request.) Two of my children happen to have been born on the same day. I sometimes write about that experience.

Don't have time for a full review of something? Why not try my 5-second reviews?

Occasionally, I write a post for Eschewmenical.

I'm just some guy that likes anime, manga, science fiction, fantasy, video games, philosophy, Japanese language and culture and programming.

I also know some Python, HTML, CSS and Javascript; a little bit of C and PHP; even less SQL; and enough to know my way around in Linux (Debian/Mint/CentOS).

I was appointed ♦ Moderator Pro Tempore on Anime and Manga SE, and served my time from January 2013 to March 2015.
I am currently an employee for Stack Exchange!

If there's anything you think I could help you with, you can reach me via the "contact us" link at the bottom of every page1, or at jnat@stackoverflow.com2.

1 there's about a 50% chance I'll be the one to see your message there
2 if you really want to make sure I'll be the one to see it

Hello there, curious passer-by! I'm Tim, and I work here. I'm the Director of Stack Overflow Communities here at Stack Exchange, and I head up efforts to help Stack Overflow stay healthy and grow, sometimes in different languages :)

If you need to reach me, I'm tpost@stackoverflow.com. You can also follow me on Twitter, I'm usually not boring.

@tinkertim | Public Key

"Learn, and let others Learn !"

I have a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science(2011-2015).

I am available for a Application Development/Network Programming/Operating System related job in any part of the world. Want to hire me? Check my profile

Please don't expect me to answer/join "PURE WEB-APPLICATION DEVELOPMENT" related questions. I hate that domain.

My favourite Answers on Stack Overflow which were not viewed much ->

  1. Operating System - Context switches

  2. Why we can't reliably test for palindromes on one pass in a finite-memory system

  3. How much cpu does the following operation take? any way to truly calculate it?

  4. Compiler Type Promotion of Right Hand Side expressions automatically in an Assignment Statement

If any query, contact me at shekhar[DOT]suman396[AT]gmail[DOT]com. 

Languages :- Java, C, Rust(started learning)
Platform  :- Linux(CentOS)
IDE       :- NetBeans, Emacs

Thanks for visiting my profile. Wish you have a good day and lots of reputations earnt.

C# and WPF developer who is always excited to try a new technology or technique in the .NET world.

I'm usually hanging around in the WPF and C# chat rooms, so feel free to ping me there!
Software Engineer. Woodworker. Soon to be black smith!

Physics underflow is a new forthcoming physics community for beginner and undergraduate level people. It will be free from policies and strict rules. It will not be a Q2A library. It will be a community. Genuine questions will not be closed as homework. Those who need help for resource recommendation will be helped. It will be a community like Math.SE. There will be fun, not humiliation. A community website free from some old cranky farts.

Now a days Phys.SE doesn't welcome beginners and they are outnumbered on meta too with the downvotes.

I've proposed a new website for Physics problems on Area51. Intereseted users can follow it.

I am:

  • VP of Community Growth at StackExchange.
  • Griffin and Maeve's dad.
  • Not tall.

I'm pretty much always trying to be helpful. If I'm not succeeding, just let me know. (Okay, so maybe I wasn't trying that hard in this question. But usually.

Core developer at Stack Exchange.

Everything I post on this site are my own opinions only, and I don't speak for the company. Also, I'm not a sex professional, so take my posts with a grain of salt.

I have been developing since 1989 in the fields of academia, financial, research, medical, banking, non-profit and military. I am Micro$oft, Cisco and Juniper certified. Extensive knowledge of Windows, Office and Adobe Suites, Lotus and Unix/Linux. Professional knowledge of VB 5-6, ASP, .NET, Cobol, Fortran, Pascal, Assembly, Visual C++, Java, JS, PHP, HTML, XML, GreaseMonkey, TamperMonkey, Wordpress, AJAX, SharePoint, Azure and JQuery (to name a few). Database knowledge of DBase, Access, MS SQL, mySQL, and Sqlite. Constantly learning more and trying to improve my knowledge of new technologies. Hardware knowledge which includes PCs, Servers, Networks, and Mobile.

I have been an elite grey hat hacker (white/black) in my professional life and red hat in my military service. I have worked with countless intelligence agencies as well as security organizations. I have expertise in encryption, obfuscation, encoding/decoding, and compression technologies. Expertise in all manner of algorithms (biological and artificial intelligence sims, and heuristics).

I served as a Major in the Marine Corp special forces from 1992 to 2003 and Lt. Col. from 2004 to 2006 after which I was honorably discharged. I have degrees in BioChemistry, Physics, Philosophy, Psychology and Political Science. 1st year residency medical school (didn't finish), public health with Epidemiology emphasis (internships at the CDC and NIH), and genetic engineering (participant of the Genome Project). Have taught Java, VB, C++ and Networking (Cisco CCNA/CCNP/Voice/Security) as an associate professor. Juris Doctor law degree (no bar exam - yet/undecided) teaching legal theories, intellectual property and business law.

Anything else you want to know, just ask, you can reach me through my blog (although I haven not had much time to write too much) where my other contacts are listed for Facebook, deviantArt, Scribd, InformAction, or you can email me directly.

Moderator for Puzzling.SE.

click here to edit

Hi! I'm Santa Claus. Besides for the cookies, it's gotten pretty boring up here on the North Pole. My elves have been busy making toys for young children this Christmas, so I have had some time to learn about iOS and web development!

Just remember, be good and you won't end up on my naughty list! Those on my naughty list end up with MySQL errors for christmas, as well as 404 - Present not found errors.

I find that chmod -R 000 /presents/ is nice to hide things from prying eyes.

Don't forget to leave me waffles (cookies work too, but waffles are better) this Christmas!

I have a pet reindeer named Rudolph too.

Also, I am a WWDC 2015 Student Scholarship Recipient!

Howdy!

I'm Morwenn. You might have come across my profile near a C++ question. That wouldn't be surprising since I am almost always toying in a dark corner of your bedroom with some modern C++ features (don't be afraid :p); I gave up keeping the actual C++ version I'm using up-to-date in this profile, but it should be the latest version available, any time, plus some experimental features. I sometimes try to contribute to the C++ standard and occasionally help modernizing open-source C++ projects.

When I'm not torturing templates, I develop some small scripts or applications with Python. Once in a while it doesn't hurt, and Sphinx is definitely the best thing that happened to project documentation.

Let's talk about hobbies now? :) I love to listen to music all day long while doing anything - psytrance is a must while programming. I also love to talk about music and to play music. I have been playing the recorder in a celtic metal band for some time now, that's plenty of fun ^^

Whatever, I don't know what to add. You can check my GitHub if you feel like it, there are some modern C++ libraries and other pseudo-random stuff over there. Anyway, have a good day and have fun programming, that's what matters the most! :)
Just another software geek... and aspiring polymath. (Also: photographer, aspiring filmmaker, artist, etc.)
15-year-old homoflexible dork who likes music and video games. Have a part-time job at an arcade. Ideal future is being a musician.
Problem solver?
Freelance Developer of iOS-Apps, Web-Designer and -Developer. Native language: German

I work at the University of New South Wales, where I use Ruby to analyze biological data.

In part of my spare time, I work on fun programming projects. One was trying to analyze what underlies Wikipedia's Get to Philosophy game. I also worked on one called the "Small Eigen Collider".

I'm currently learning Japanese, and I'm an active participant in lang-8.com, a website where you write journal entries in a language you're learning, and get corrected by native speakers of that language. In return, you correct people writing entries in your native language. Recently, I've been asking a few questions prompted by slightly incorrect English I've encountered on lang-8.

I am new to Java and Bukkit but I manage to get through.

I am lone developer in an obscure department of a business organization, trying to prove my usefulness. I am learning Java, SQL, JavaScript (after four years, still learning). I like database design. nifty JavaScript frameworks, RAD tools.

Software Engineer in Ohio, USA.

Native American English speaker, student of Japanese.

ASP.NET programmer by day, FFXIV player by night. :)

Graduated LVC, BS in CS. Mostly used Linux (slackware circa kernel 1.2.8) as my main OS, but gradually used Windows 95 more. Initially did some system admin work in NT4, then went the direction of programming, working mostly in Access 97 (for frontend and backend) for about 2 years. After picking up DB design, moved up to MSSQL 7, with VB6 for a frontend. Designed many classic ASP apps with compiled web class ActiveX DLL's and MSSQL 2000 as the DB server. Picked up MySQL and Oracle.

In 2003, started full time development in VC++ with MFC. Started using subversion in combination with bugzilla for management of off-the-shelf kiosk application. In 2005, started dev in .Net 2.0 with C#. Actively develop company website transaction management in ASP.Net, with MSSQL 2005 backend.

Currently learning EF4 in the hope of porting a VB6 Application using an Access 2000 backend to a .Net 4 application using WPF with the MVVM pattern, and SQLite DB for backend.

I work at KioWare, which makes Kiosk Software for Windows and Android.

By day: strategic forecaster and planner for a large non-profit

By night: blogger about tantric sex and other things related to good sex, especially for couples in long-term relationships

Ethnicity: 1st gen American, 2nd gen ex-Indian "coconut," brown on the outside and 100% America on the inside, so please don't ask me about India. I have an interest and lots of opinions, but no first-hand knowledge.

Back in the dark ages, I studied systems, anthropology (a bit), evolution, and neuroscience.
